abstracts.cdata!:
The amendment will restructure the
            Project's design and make its comprehensive public
            sector reform approach more consistent with the
            government's strategy and country's possibilities
            for reform. Despite the difficult political and social
            situation in Bolivia, the Government maintains its
            commitment to advance in some of the reform areas covered by
            the project. For this purpose the government requests: (1)
            the transfer of the Project's Technical Unit from the
            Ministry of Sustainable Development to the Ministry of
            Finance; (2) cancellation of the components pertaining to
            Part A - Performance-oriented Management and Evaluation of
            Public Sector Organizations and Part B - Combating
            Corruption; (3) correction of 1998 baseline and
            corresponding figures of Performance Benchmarks No. 3 and
            No. 4 for the period 2000-2004; and (4) reallocation of
            amounts and redistribution of financial resources
            corresponding to category 3 salaries, as well as
            cancellation of SDR 1,204,424 (US1.73 million equivalent) of
            the Development Credit Agreement and the co-financing grant
            agreements (related trust funds).
